metadata.Title: CVE-2010-2496 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
stonith-ng in pacemaker and cluster-glue passed passwords as commandlineparameters, making it possible for local attackers to gain access topasswords of the HA stack and potentially influence its operations. This isfixed in cluster-glue 1.0.6 and newer, and pacemaker 1.1.3 and newer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-2496` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cluster-glue - 1.0.12-7build1
liblrm2 - 1.0.12-7build1
libpils2 - 1.0.12-7build1
libplumb2 - 1.0.12-7build1
libplumbgpl2 - 1.0.12-7build1
libstonith1 - 1.0.12-7build1
No subscription required

libcib4 - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.3
libcrmcluster4 - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.3
libcrmcommon3 - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.3
libcrmservice3 - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.3
liblrmd1 - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.3
libpe-rules2 - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.3
libpe-status10 - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.3
libpengine10 - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.3
libstonithd2 - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.3
libtransitioner2 - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.3
pacemaker - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.3
pacemaker-cli-utils - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.3
pacemaker-common - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.3
pacemaker-remote - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.3
pacemaker-resource-agents - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cluster-glue package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.12-7build1').
pacemaker package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.18-0ubuntu1.3').
